items.headline: Leading Inference Providers Cut AI Costs by up to 10x With Open Source Models on NVIDIA Blackwell

content.excerpt_text: A diagnostic insight in healthcare. A character’s dialogue in an interactive game. An autonomous resolution from a customer service agent. Each of these AI-powered interactions is built on the same unit of intelligence: a token. Scaling these AI interactions requires businesses to consider whether they can afford more tokens. The answer lies in better tokenomics Read Article

items.headline: NVIDIA DGX Spark Powers Big Projects in Higher Education

content.excerpt_text: At leading institutions across the globe, the NVIDIA DGX Spark desktop supercomputer is bringing data‑center‑class AI to lab benches, faculty offices and students’ systems. There’s even a DGX Spark hard at work in the South Pole, at the IceCube Neutrino Observatory run by the University of Wisconsin-Madison. The compact supercomputer’s petaflop‑class performance enables local deployment Read Article

items.headline: GeForce NOW Celebrates Six Years of Streaming With 24 Games in February

content.excerpt_text: Break out the cake and green sprinkles — GeForce NOW is turning six. Since launch, members have streamed over 1 billion hours, and the party’s just getting started. items.headline: Everything Will Be Represented in a Virtual Twin, NVIDIA CEO Jensen Huang Says at 3DEXPERIENCE World

content.excerpt_text: NVIDIA founder and CEO Jensen Huang and Dassault Systèmes CEO Pascal Daloz announced a partnership to build a shared industrial AI architecture, merging virtual twins with physics-based AI to redefine the future of design, engineering and manufacturing.

items.headline: Dassault Systèmes and NVIDIA Partner to Build Industrial AI Platform Powering Virtual Twins

items.headline: Into the Omniverse: Physical AI Open Models and Frameworks Advance Robots and Autonomous Systems

content.excerpt_text: Open source has become essential for driving innovation in robotics and autonomy. By providing access to critical infrastructure — from simulation frameworks to AI models — NVIDIA is enabling collaborative development that accelerates the path to safer, more capable autonomous systems.

items.headline: GeForce NOW Brings GeForce RTX Gaming to Linux PCs

content.excerpt_text: Get ready to game — the native GeForce NOW app for Linux PCs is now available in beta, letting Linux desktops tap directly into GeForce RTX performance from the cloud. items.headline: NVIDIA Sets Conference Call for Fourth-Quarter Financial Results

content.excerpt_text: NVIDIA will host a conference call on Wednesday, February 25, at 2 p.m. PT (5 p.m. ET) to discuss its financial results for the fourth quarter and fiscal year 2026, which ended January 25, 2026.

items.headline: NVIDIA Launches Earth-2 Family of Open Models — the World’s First Fully Open, Accelerated Set of Models and Tools for AI Weather

content.excerpt_text: At the American Meteorological Society’s Annual Meeting, NVIDIA today unveiled a new NVIDIA Earth-2 family of open models, libraries and frameworks for weather and climate AI, offering the world’s first fully open, production-ready weather AI software stack.

source_payload.html: At the American Meteorological Society’s Annual Meeting, NVIDIA today unveiled a new NVIDIA Earth-2 family of open models, libraries and frameworks for weather and climate AI, offering the world’s first fully open, production-ready weather AI software stack.

items.headline: NVIDIA and CoreWeave Strengthen Collaboration to Accelerate Buildout of AI Factories

content.excerpt_text: NVIDIA (Nasdaq: NVDA) and CoreWeave, Inc. (Nasdaq: CRWV) today announced an expansion of their long-standing complementary relationship to enable CoreWeave to accelerate the buildout of more than 5 gigawatts of AI factories by 2030 to advance AI adoption at global scale.

source_payload.html: NVIDIA (Nasdaq: NVDA) and CoreWeave, Inc. (Nasdaq: CRWV) today announced an expansion of their long-standing complementary relationship to enable CoreWeave to accelerate the buildout of more than 5 gigawatts of AI factories by 2030 to advance AI adoption at global scale.
